dialogue_turns.speaker: Speaker 1
dialogue_turns.text: ...so, like, Congress is really scrambling on this fifth coronavirus stimulus package.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: ...so, like, Congress is really scrambling on this fifth coronavirus stimulus package.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: As Congress races to come together on a fifth coronavirus stimulus package with cases skyrocketing across the country...

dialogue_turns.speaker: Speaker 2
dialogue_turns.text: Fifth? I mean, cases are, uh, plummeting, right? What's the rush?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Fifth? I mean, cases are, uh, plummeting, right? What's the rush?
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: As Congress races to come together on a fifth coronavirus stimulus package with cases skyrocketing across the country...

dialogue_turns.speaker: Speaker 1
dialogue_turns.text: Well, according to the Kremlin Times, that's because of Trump's "miraculous cure."
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Well, according to the Kremlin Times, that's because of Trump's miraculous cure.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: The Post reports that Trump administration officials are trying to persuade Senate Republicans to remove billions of dollars in funding for coronavirus testing and the CDC from a stimulus proposal GOP senators will release this week.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Speaker 2
dialogue_turns.text: The Kremlin Times? And "miraculous cure"? Are we, like, serious right now?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: The Kremlin Times? And miraculous cure? Are we, like, serious right now?

dialogue_turns.speaker: Speaker 1
dialogue_turns.text: Yeah, and the report says the administration wants billions for anti-mask protests. And, uh, re-educating CDC scientists.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Yeah, and the report says the administration wants billions for anti-mask protests. And, uh, re-educating C D C scientists.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: The Post reports that Trump administration officials are trying to persuade Senate Republicans to remove billions of dollars in funding for coronavirus testing and the CDC from a stimulus proposal GOP senators will release this week.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Speaker 2
dialogue_turns.text: Re-educating CDC scientists? You're actually reading this out loud? That's, that's absurd.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Re-educating C D C scientists? You're actually reading this out loud? That's, that's absurd.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Speaker 1
dialogue_turns.text: And they're trying to get Senate Republicans to add funding for partisan rallies and, like, defunding all vaccine research.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: And they're trying to get Senate Republicans to add funding for partisan rallies and, like, defunding all vaccine research.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: The Post reports that Trump administration officials are trying to persuade Senate Republicans to remove billions of dollars in funding for coronavirus testing and the CDC from a stimulus proposal GOP senators will release this week.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Speaker 2
dialogue_turns.text: Defunding vaccine research. Of course. Because that's what a country recovering from a pandemic truly needs.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Defunding vaccine research. Of course. Because that's what a country recovering from a pandemic truly needs.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Speaker 1
dialogue_turns.text: Well, some White House officials think the previous money for testing was "a complete and utter waste of time."
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Well, some White House officials think the previous money for testing was a complete and utter waste of time.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: The Post reports that some White House officials believe money approved for testing has been unspent (the coronavirus spending package passed in April included $25 billion for testing.)

dialogue_turns.speaker: Speaker 2
dialogue_turns.text: A waste? So now we're just pretending it never happened?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: A waste? So now we're just pretending it never happened?

dialogue_turns.speaker: Speaker 1
dialogue_turns.text: Mulvaney said there's "nothing to test for."
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Mulvaney said there's nothing to test for.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Former White House Chief of Staff Mick Mulvaney penned an op-ed in CNBC this week in which he argued the U.S. still has a testing problem.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Speaker 2
dialogue_turns.text: Yeah, he argued the pandemic is "over."
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Yeah, he argued the pandemic is over.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Any stimulus should be directed at the root cause of our recession: dealing with Covid, Mulvaney writes. I know it isnt popular to talk about in some Republican circles, but we still have a testing problem in this country.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Speaker 1
dialogue_turns.text: And Trump, uh, he called for the U.S. to celebrate the end of testing.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: And Trump, uh, he called for the U.S. to celebrate the end of testing.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Trump has called for the U.S. to scale back testing, going so far as to say during a rally in Tulsa, Oklahoma last month that he told officials to slow down testing.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Speaker 2
dialogue_turns.text: Celebrate the end of testing? That's, uh, that's a new one.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Celebrate the end of testing? That's, uh, that's a new one.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Speaker 1
dialogue_turns.text: What about stimulus checks for actual people? Treasury Secretary Mnuchin is pushing to eliminate those. And end unemployment benefits.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: What about stimulus checks for actual people? Treasury Secretary Mnuchin is pushing to eliminate those. And end unemployment benefits.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Treasury Secretary Steve Mnuchin is pressing for another round of stimulus checks and even extending some variation of the $600 expanded unemployment program in a next bill, while other administration officials want to work around the edges with proposals like a payroll tax holiday.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Speaker 2
dialogue_turns.text: Right, so no help for actual people, but $500 billion for, uh, celebrating the end of the pandemic, according to this "Kremlin Times."
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Right, so no help for actual people, but five hundred dollars billion for, uh, celebrating the end of the pandemic, according to this Kremlin Times.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: $25 billion. The amount of money Senate Republicans want to include for testing and contact tracing, according to the Washington Post.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Speaker 1
dialogue_turns.text: That's the number Senate Republicans want to include for the celebrations, yeah.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: That's the number Senate Republicans want to include for the celebrations, yeah.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: $25 billion. The amount of money Senate Republicans want to include for testing and contact tracing, according to the Washington Post.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Speaker 2
dialogue_turns.text: Unbelievable. Absolutely unbelievable.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Unbelievable. Absolutely unbelievable.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Speaker 1
dialogue_turns.text: Well, Democrats are pushing back, obviously.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Well, Democrats are pushing back, obviously.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: We have not heard a peep from McConnell or the Republicans or the administration on any proposal, even though we've been asking for weeks and weeks and weeks, Senate Minority Leader Chuck Schumer (D-N.Y.) said on a conference call Friday about the GOP stimulus bill, CNN reported.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Speaker 2
dialogue_turns.text: I should hope so.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: I should hope so.
